justification: The paper explains that "the so-called Weight of Advice (WoA) measure was calculated … WoA scores therefore reflect whether received advice was incorporated into own judgements," making WoA the metric for advice utilization.

During each trial, participants "were asked to indicate their confidence in the accuracy of their estimate by setting a slider to values between 0 (no confidence at all) and 100 (absolute confidence)", so the slider rating functions as the confidence measure.
